name: DNS Zones
description: DNS Zone endpoints provide a means of managing the DNS DNS Zone objects on your account. Note: the validation rules for DNS records are too complicated to document here. We'll just direct you to [RFC 1035](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1035.txt).

dns/zones.description: Manage the collection of DNS Zones your account may access.

GET.description: Returns a list of DNS Zones.

type.description: DNS Zone type as master or slave.

description.description: A description to keep track of this DNS Zone.

refresh_sec.description: Time interval before the DNS Zone should be refreshed, in seconds.

retry_sec.description:
Time interval that should elapse before a failed refresh should
  be retried, in seconds.

expire_sec.description:
Time value that specifies the upper limit on
  the time interval that can elapse before the DNS Zone is no
  longer authoritative, in seconds.

ttl_sec.description:
Time interval that the resource record may be cached before
  it should be discarded, in seconds.

status.description: The status of the DNS Zone; it can be disabled, active, or edit_mode.

master_ips.description: An array of IP addresses for this DNS Zone.

axfr_ips.description: An array of IP addresses allowed to AXFR the entire DNS Zone.

display_group.description: A display group to keep track of this DNS Zone.

examples.curl:
curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
    -H "Authorization: token $TOKEN" \
    -X POST -d '{
        "dnszone": "example.com",
        "type": "master",
        "soa_email": "admin@example.com",
        "description": "Example Description",
        "refresh_sec": 14400,
        "retry_sec": 3600,
        "expire_sec": 604800,
        "ttl_sec": 3600,
        "status": "active",
        "master_ips": ["127.0.0.1","255.255.255.1","123.123.123.7"],
        "axfr_ips": ["44.55.66.77"],
        "display_group": "Example Display Group"
    }'
    https://$api_root/$version/dns/zones

GET.description: Returns information for the DNS Zone identified by :id.

examples.curl:
curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: token TOKEN" \
  -X PUT -d '{
    "dnszone": "examplechange.com",
    "description": "The changed description",
    "display_group": "New display group",
    "status": "edit_mode",
    "soa_email": "newemail@example.com",
    "retry_sec": 3602,
    "master_ips": ["123.456.789.101", "192.168.1.1", "127.0.0.1"],
    "axfr_ips": ["55.66.77.88"],
    "expire_sec": 604802,
    "refresh_sec": 14402,
    "ttl_sec": 3602
  }'
  https://$api_root/$version/dns/zones/$dnszone_id

DELETE.description: Deletes the DNS zone. This action cannot be undone.

dns/zones/:id/records.description: Manage the collection of DNS Zone Records your account may access.

GET.description: Returns a list of DNS Zone Records.

name.description: The hostname or FQDN. When type=MX the subdomain to delegate to the Target MX server.

target.description: When Type=MX the hostname. When Type=CNAME the target of the alias. When Type=TXT the value of the record. When Type=A or AAAA the token of '[remote_addr]' will be substituted with the IP address of the request.

priority.description: Priority for MX and SRV records.

weight.description: A relative weight for records with the same priority, higher value means more preferred.

port.description: The TCP or UDP port on which the service is to be found.

service.description: The service to append to an SRV record.

protocol.description: The protocol to append to an SRV record.

ttl.description:
Time interval that the resource record may be cached before
  it should be discarded. In seconds. Leave as 0 to accept
  our default.

GET.description: Returns information for the DNS Zone Record identified by ":id".

PUT.description: Modifies a given DNS Zone Record.

DELETE.description: Deletes the DNS Zone Record. This action cannot be undone.
